Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Preferential adsorption due to stronger van der Waals and CH-π interactions

Other Information.Additional Info: Ethane exhibits higher uptake compared to ethylene.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Adsorption but weaker interaction compared to ethane

Other Information.Additional Info: Ethylene is less strongly adsorbed than ethane.

Sieving Mechanism: Preferential adsorption of ethane over ethylene due to stronger host-guest interactions.

Experimental Validation.Method: 1H MAS NMR spectroscopy, breakthrough experiments, computational density distributions
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: IAST selectivity for C2H6/C2H4: 1.66 at 1 bar, separation factor: 1.36

Other Information.Additional Info: Stronger van der Waals and CH-π interactions favor ethane adsorption.
No preferential adsorption observed between ethane and ethylene.
No preferential adsorption observed between ethane and ethylene.

Sieving Mechanism: No significant preferential adsorption between ethane and ethylene.

Experimental Validation.Method: 1H MAS NMR spectroscopy, breakthrough experiments, computational density distributions
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: IAST selectivity for C2H6/C2H4: 1.38 at 1 bar, separation factor: 1.01

Other Information.Additional Info: C−H···O interaction between ethylene and aldehyde group reduces selectivity.
